==German== {{wikipedia|dab=Salz|lang=de}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|salz}} (akin to {{cog|osx|salt}}, {{cog|odt|salt}}, {{cog|ang|sealt}}, {{cog|non|salt}}), from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*saltą}}, from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*seh₂l-|*séh₂l-}}, {{m|ine-pro|*séh₂ls}}. Compare {{cog|nl|zout}}, {{cog|en|salt}}, {{cog|da|salt}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/zal(t)s/}} * {{audio|de|De-Salz.ogg|audio}} * {{rhymes|de|alts|als}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n|Salzes|Salze}} # {{lb|de|uncountable}} [[salt]], [[table salt]] #: {{syn|de|Kochsalz|Speisesalz|Tafelsalz}} # [[salt]], [[sal]] ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-n|es|e}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|salzig}} ====Related terms==== {{rel3|de |Kalisalz |Kochsalz |Kristallsalz |Meeressalz |Speisesalz |Steinsalz |Streusalz |Tafelsalz |Salzbergwerk |Salzbrezel |Salzgebäck |Salzkartoffel |Salzkorn |Salzkristall |Salzmangel |Salzmine |Salzsee |Salzstange |Salzstreuer |Salzvorkommen |Salzwasser |Salzwüste }} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Luxembourgish== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|lb|goh|salz}}, from {{inh|lb|gem-pro|*saltą}}.
